result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Violation of Individual at Risk Restraining Order or Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melinda A Bannister

records.addlTxt:
(SF) 16CV281 and 15CM18 called at 10:06 am
Defendant Melinda A Bannister in court, in custody via video from Indiana Madison Correctional Facility. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Betty Montgomery appears by telephone in regards to 16CV281. John Flint appears in person in regards to 16CV281.

Court finds the video to be sight sufficient.
Court reviews that the hearing is in regards to the Defendant's letter.
Court reviews procedural posture of the cases.

DA Happ advises that the State is requesting that the warrant remain.
Mr. Flint requests that the orders remain in place.
Ms. Montgomery requests the order remain in place.

Ms. Bannister requests written correspondence with Ms. Montgomery.
Mr. Flint advises that he has spoken with Ms. Montgomery and she had advised that she did not want contact, but the Court should inquire that of Ms. Montgomery.
Ms. Montgomery is unsure if she would like written communication.

Court orders that the warrant in 15CM18 remain in effect.
In 16CV281 the Court does not believe that it has jurisdication in this format to amend the Injunction, the Court would be able to carve out an exception if there was a stipulation between the parties.
Court indicates to the parties that it would also consider an amendment to the injuction to allow for written contact if Ms. Montgomery and Mr. Flint submitted a written statement to the Court requesting the amendment.

recess: 10:22 am
Motion hearing on November 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Denied request to quash warrant. Defendant to appear in Jefferson County WI once released from custody in Indiana.
Letter from the Defendant requesting the warrant be lifted or a hearing be set by video or phone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Hassin presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 10:30am. [MK]
Defendant Melinda A Bannister not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ reports that mailing to the Portland, Indiana address was returned by the Postal Service as being undeliverable. 
The Court orders issuance of a probable cause warrant, setting a $5,000 cash bond on that warrant. 
recess 10:30am.
